X.T: Electronic Data Capture - Technology Blog
SAE Reporting in EDC Trials
X.ST: Integrating SAE handling into EDC systems reduces workload and increases accuracy and efficiency

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The authors lists the requirements on an EDC system in order to correctly support SAE reporting and the advantages of such a solution.

X.T: An examination of DataSci's EDC Patent 6496827

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A company, DataSci, has patented EDC over Internet!

X.T: The future of the offline model in Electronic Data Capture Systems

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Offline EDC has never really taken off and will probably disappear in the future.

X.T: EDC Endpoints

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author proposes to flag the end points among all the captured data in order to be able to perform a statistical analysis earlier: this one would be done when only all end points are recorded and reviewed instead of when all data values are recorded and reviewed.

X.T: Should eClinical systems be 'EndPoint' aware

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The continuation of the previous blog: the author answers to a comment.

X.T: Applying XForms to CDISC

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says it all, but the author does not suggest the same solution as JozefÆrts who proposes to generates CRFs as XForms from ODM.

X.T: Expert Electronic Data Capture Systems

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Current EDC software has no built-in knowledge about clinical data, the author suggests that it is time to change that and to put domain expertise in EDC systems.

X.T: Expert EDC Systems and Patient Templates

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author proposes to define Patient Templates: these would be study building components encoding some semantic (e.g. how to compute the BMI, hard/soft checks on weight/height, obesity criteria…).

X.T: Product Maturity and EDC Systems

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author proposes a classification of EDC product maturity (a la CMM).

X.T: Providers See Opportunity and Challenges in Small Users

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some CTMS/EDC vendors target the market of small users.

X.T: The many colors of the EDC Market

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The EDC market is fragmented, each EDC vendor is specialised on some phases, some therapeutic areas…

X.T: Electronic Data Capture Survey 2011

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Eco updates his two year old survey of the EDC market.

X.T: Top 10 mistakes made when implementing EDC

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says it all.

X.T: Build vs. Buy: Considerations for EDC Investment

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A good analysis of the pros/cons of building vs. buying an EDC system.

X.T: Where do EDC 8-12 Week Lead Times come from?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Why is the study setup time still as long as it was eight years ago?

X.T: EDC Study Startup Time

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The issue is not the study setup time, but that the sponsor company must be prepared to work with EDC.

X.T: EDC Project Success
X.ST: What it takes to get all stakeholders on the same page and keep project timelimes on track.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Defining the tasks and their ownership, the documents, the testing, the training of new project members, and the communication processes, must be done at the beginning in order to have a successful trial.

X.T: How can eClinical deliver on the vision?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author suggests some ideas why the ROI of EDC is not as high as it should.

X.T: Investigative Sites: The Trouble with e-Clinical Technologies

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some complaints of clinical research coordinators about the EDC systems they have to use.

X.T: Site Solutions for All that Ails EDC

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The continuation of the previous article.

X.T: More Paper, More Burden?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A survey shows that using EDC results in more work for the study coordinators.

X.T: Sites+EDC=Pain

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Sites complain that they have to enter the data in the EHR and in the EDC, that performance is low, and that the server crashes when two many users access it at the same time (e.g. during randomisation of large cohorts or just before the database lock).

X.T: Site Pain With EDC

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The continuation of the previous article: sponsors do not acquire data the same way, sites must work with different EDC systems without being properly trained, EDC is not ready when the study starts…

X.T: eClinical Authentication : Proving your users are who they say they are

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Password sharing may be prevented by putting some personal value in the electronic account.

X.T: Digital Signatures Accelerate Clinical Operations and Audits

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The advantages of using a PKI: avoiding paper transfer from the sites to the CRO, respect of 21 CFR Part 11 without using a proprietary solution, and secure document exchange.

X.T: Single Sign-On Across All eClinical Systems

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author suggests to use OpenID as a SSO solution for all studies of a sponsor or CRO.

X.T: Tools for validating data in EDC

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The evolution of the data checking tools and why some standardisation is needed.

X.T: EDC Rules - When should they run?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A question and an answer on when the rules should be checked.

X.T: Running Rules in EDC - further commentary

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The continuation of the previous discussion.

X.T: Value of Batch validation?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Yet another blog about when the checks shall be performed.

X.T: CDISC Rules!

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author suggests that, a standard such as ARDEN or RuleML, could be used to encode checks in ODM.

X.T: CDISC Rules 2

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author changed his mind and explains that there is no real need for transferring the checks between systems.

X.T: Return of the 4GL for eClinical? - Part 1

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of 4GL for dummies.

X.T: Return of the 4GL for eClinical? - Part 2

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The requirements on an EDC system: trigger support, human readability, testability… I find this presentation sometimes unclear and messy, but there is some good food for though in it.

X.T: The Classic Software Debate Takes a Turn
X.ST: With the option to rent, the buy vs. build debate over software is kaput when it comes to major applications.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The usual explanation why renting software is better than buying it, which is itself better than building it. This is a general presentation, not EDC specific.

X.T: Paul Bleicher on SaaS

ARTICLE.COMMENT: This is an answer to the previous article: why SaaS is not adequate for the EDC market.

X.T: Are You Ready for EDC Technology Transfer?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A guideline for CROs who want to handle the EDC task themselves.

X.T: Problems in EDC-land, Software vs Service

ARTICLE.COMMENT: EDC companies should and will stop providing service.

X.T: CTMS in EDC?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some thoughts about the poor CTMS/EDC integration.

X.T: Do you believe in Best of Breed eClinical?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The clinical tools integrated in the EDC solutions are currently rather limited, but it may be better to use them, especially for small CROs and sponsors, rather than spending time and money to integrate the best CDMS, CTMS…

X.T: eClinical Vendors - Build or Merge

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Merged companies do not provide solutions which are properly integrated together.

X.T: “Dumb Monkey” Wins SCDM Innovation Award

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A tool to traverse the whole application and grab all screens.
